newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Sampoerna surges following news report.
newsitem.headline: Sampoerna surges following news report.

text.p: Indonesian cigarette company PT Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna continued to surge on Tuesday following a news report that it would sell its 2.85 percent stake in car maker Astra International, brokers said.
It had risen 500 rupiah, or 2.47 percent, to 20,750 rupiah on a volume of 485,000 shares by 0500 GMT after rising to 21,000 rupiah in early trade.

"The news has given a positive sentiment to the stock but the upside appears to be limited as many investors are waiting for further disclosure of its investment in Astra and the purpose of its $400 million loan," said one foreign broker.
Another foreign broker said many investors were interested in buying-back Sampoerna shares as the firm was considered to have good fundamentals.
"Recent news that Sampoerna had increased the retail price of its cigarettes also helped to improve sentiment in the stock but players are buying only limited amounts," he added.
Brokers said the cancellation of Sampoerna's shareholders' meeting scheduled for November 2 had also boosted sentiment.
They said there had been speculation the meeting would have discussed the possible purchase of more Astra shares by Sampoerna, which recently secured a $400 million short-term bank loan.
Sampoerna had said the money would go towards "corporate development" but did not give details.
